alert.note: Alert for Buckeye, Avondale; Central Phoenix; East Valley; Fountain Hills, East Mesa; North Phoenix, Glendale; Scottsdale, Paradise Valley; South Mountain, Ahwatukee; Southeast Valley, Queen Creek (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 02 at 4:00PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Maricopa and Pinal Counties through 445 PM MST... At 359 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking outflow winds from strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Scottsdale to near Fountain Hills to near Granite Reef Dam to near Salt River Tubing Recreation Area. Movement was southwest at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Mesa, Chandler, Scottsdale, Gilbert, Tempe, Paradise Valley, East Mesa, Tempe Marketplace, Papago Park, Piestewa Peak Park, Granite Reef Dam, Falcon Field Airport, Salt River Indian Community, South Phoenix, Arizona State Fairgrounds, Usery Mountain Park, San Tan Village Mall, Freestone Park and South Mountain Park. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 143 and 165. AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 195 and 206. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 1 and 9. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MST for south central and southeastern Arizona.
